definitions: one of the twelve major deities of ancient Greek mythology dwelling on Mount Olympus
athlete who competes in the Olympic Games at international level
person displaying godlike qualities of superiority, detachment, or exceptional ability
examples: Zeus ruled as the king of the Olympians from Mount Olympus
The ancient Greeks worshipped the twelve Olympians through elaborate rituals
She became an Olympian after qualifying for the swimming team
The retired Olympian now coaches young athletes in track events
His Olympian detachment from office politics impressed his colleagues
She maintained an Olympian calm despite the surrounding chaos

definitions: resistance, disagreement, or hostility toward something or someone through action or argument
political party or group opposing the party in power or government policies
celestial position where two bodies appear opposite each other in the sky
examples: The proposal faced strong opposition from environmental groups
Their opposition to the new policy sparked heated debates
The opposition party criticized the government's economic policies
Members of the opposition walked out during the parliamentary session
Mars will be in opposition to Earth next month
During opposition, planets appear brightest in the night sky

definitions: round citrus fruit with thick skin and juicy segments containing vitamin C
bright color between red and yellow in the visible spectrum
European royal house that ruled the Netherlands and influenced British history
examples: She peeled the orange and shared its segments with friends
Fresh orange juice contains more vitamins than processed varieties
The sunset painted the sky in brilliant shades of orange
He wore an orange safety vest while working on the highway
William of Orange became King of England in 1689
The House of Orange still reigns in the Netherlands today

definitions: systematic arrangement of items according to specific criteria or patterns
authoritative command or instruction that must be followed
request for goods or services to be supplied or performed
organized group bound by common rules, purposes, or religious vows
taxonomic rank in biological classification between class and family
examples: The books were arranged in alphabetical order on the shelf
She restored order to the chaotic filing system
The general issued orders for immediate evacuation
Court orders must be obeyed or face legal consequences
He placed an order for twenty units of inventory
Your order will arrive within three business days

She joined a religious order dedicated to helping the poor
Primates belong to the order of mammals
The order Lepidoptera includes all butterflies and moths

definitions: countries of Asia, especially East Asia, viewed from a Western historical perspective
pearl of superior quality with exceptional luster from Eastern waters
examples: Merchants traveled to the Orient seeking spices and silk
Art from the Orient influenced European design movements significantly
The necklace featured rare orient pearls from the Persian Gulf
Orient pearls commanded the highest prices in jewelry markets

definitions: artistic and literary style imitating or depicting aspects of Middle Eastern and Asian cultures
academic field studying Eastern languages, cultures, and histories from Western perspectives
Western stereotypical representation and interpretation of Eastern cultures often criticized as reductive
examples: The museum's orientalism collection features nineteenth-century European paintings
Decorative orientalism became popular in Victorian interior design
He pursued orientalism studies at the university's Asian department

Modern scholars challenge traditional orientalism's colonial perspectives

definitions: golden statuette awarded annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
code word representing the letter O in NATO phonetic alphabet communications
masculine given name of Irish and English origin meaning deer lover
examples: She won an Oscar for Best Actress in a Leading Role
The film received five Oscar nominations including Best Picture
The pilot used Oscar to indicate the letter O in radio communications
In military communications, November Oscar means NO
Oscar Wilde was a famous Irish playwright and poet
They named their son Oscar after his grandfather

definitions: padded footstool or low seat without back or arms for resting feet
vast empire controlled by Turkish dynasties from 1299 to 1922 spanning three continents
member or supporter of the Turkish dynasty that ruled the Ottoman Empire
examples: She propped her feet on the leather ottoman while reading
The ottoman doubled as extra seating when guests arrived

Ottoman architecture influenced building styles across the Mediterranean

definitions: board marked with letters and numbers used with a planchette for supposed spirit communication
examples: The teenagers scared themselves playing with a Ouija board at the sleepover
Ouija boards became popular during the spiritualism movement of the 1800s

definitions: collective term for Oxford and Cambridge universities representing British academic excellence and tradition
examples: Many British prime ministers received their education at Oxbridge

definitions: personal digital assistant, a handheld computer device popular before smartphones
public display of affection between people showing romantic or intimate behavior
examples: His PDA stored contacts, calendar appointments, and notes

Some cultures consider any PDA inappropriate in public spaces

definitions: domesticated animal kept for companionship, pleasure, or emotional support
positron emission tomography, medical imaging technique using radioactive tracers
examples: Her pet cat sleeps on her bed every night
The apartment allows pets under twenty-five pounds

PET imaging helps diagnose cancer and heart conditions

definitions: unique numerical identifier assigned to each running process in operating systems
infection of female reproductive organs causing inflammation and potential complications
examples: The system administrator checked the PID to terminate the frozen process

The doctor prescribed antibiotics to treat her PID infection

definitions: baked dish with pastry crust containing sweet or savory filling
mathematical constant pi representing the ratio of circumference to diameter
circular statistical chart divided into proportional segments showing data
examples: She baked an apple pie for the family dinner
The chicken pot pie contained vegetables and creamy sauce

The value of pie is approximately 3.14159

definitions: thin pointed metal fastener for holding materials together or decoration
personal identification number used for security authentication and access
wooden bottle-shaped target in bowling that players knock down

definitions: military personnel captured and held by enemy forces during armed conflict
exclamation representing the sound of a punch or sudden impact

definitions: broadcast message serving public interest by informing or educating without selling
protein produced by prostate gland measured in blood tests for cancer screening
examples: The PSA warned viewers about the dangers of drunk driving

definitions: time zone eight hours behind UTC used on North American west coast
whispered sound used to secretly get someone's attention
examples: The meeting is scheduled for 2 PM PST
California observes PST during winter months

definitions: employee benefit allowing paid absence from work for various reasons
volunteer organization of parents and teachers supporting school activities and fundraising
mechanical device transferring power from engine to attached equipment or implements

definitions: post-traumatic stress disorder, a mental health condition triggered by experiencing or witnessing traumatic events
examples: Veterans often struggle with PTSD after combat experiences
Therapy and medication can help manage PTSD symptoms effectively

definitions: polyvinyl chloride, a synthetic plastic polymer widely used in construction and manufacturing
examples: The plumber installed PVC pipes for the drainage system

definitions: nuclear reactor design using pressurized water as coolant and neutron moderator
examples: The PWR design is the most common type of nuclear reactor worldwide

definitions: Earth's largest ocean extending between Asia, Australia, and the Americas
characterized by peace, calmness, or the desire to avoid conflict
examples: Ships cross the Pacific Ocean carrying goods between continents

definitions: flooded field where rice is grown in standing water
informal sometimes offensive term for a person of Irish descent

priest in Spanish, Italian, or Portuguese speaking Catholic communities

definitions: single side of a sheet of paper in a book or document
young male servant or attendant to nobility in medieval times

examples: She turned the page to continue reading the story
The manuscript contained over three hundred pages

definitions: person who is a citizen or native of Pakistan
relating to Pakistan, its people, culture, or language
examples: The Pakistani diplomat addressed the United Nations assembly

definitions: earliest period of human history characterized by the use of primitive stone tools
examples: Palaeolithic cave paintings show early human artistic expression

definitions: earliest period of human history characterized by the use of primitive stone tools
examples: Paleolithic humans developed basic tool-making techniques

definitions: person from Palestine or of Palestinian descent

definitions: broad shallow container used for cooking food over heat
to criticize severely or give a very negative review
horizontal movement of a camera across a scene

definitions: solution or remedy claimed to solve all problems or cure all diseases

internet radio and music streaming platform using personalized recommendations

definitions: hypothetical supercontinent that existed during late Paleozoic and early Mesozoic eras
examples: Pangaea began breaking apart approximately 175 million years ago

definitions: hypothetical supercontinent that existed during late Paleozoic and early Mesozoic eras

heaven or the blessed afterlife in various religious traditions

definitions: public area of land with grass and trees for recreation and relaxation

expert in parliamentary procedure who advises on rules and protocols

definitions: ancient Greek temple on the Athenian Acropolis dedicated to goddess Athena
examples: The Parthenon remains an enduring symbol of ancient Greek civilization

definitions: SI unit of pressure equal to one newton per square meter

suffering and death of Jesus Christ in Christian theology

examples: Pentecost occurs fifty days after Easter Sunday
